additionalTextInformation.text:
The miniature is of a type, which includes woodcuts and illuminations. These were mainly used as an author’s portrait after Georg III’s death to embellish his sermons and writings published in 1555. They were also integrated into special editions of Luther’s bible quasi as representations of a princely guarantor of the reformation.
[Cat. Wolfenbüttel 2012, 85-91, No. 13]

pageContext.description:
The portrait miniature depicts a full-length portrait of Georg III of Anhalt, standing in a door-frame with a pointed arch or a niche. Coats of arms are represented on each side at the top, centre and bottom. The prince is wearing a black fur-trimmed cloak over a black doublet. In front of his chest he is holding a prayer book in both hands. His face, shown in three-quarter profile facing to the right, is plump and bearded and his mouth slightly pinched. His dark brown hair is beginning to grey. 
The coats of arms:
top left: Duchy of Anhalt and barony of Bernburg; top right: barony of Ballenstedt and County of Askanien; centre left: County of Waldersee; centre right: County of Warmsdorf; bottom left: House of Berlinger and County of Mühlingen; bottom right: Chapter of the Archdiocese of Magdeburg and Regalien. 
[see: Cat. Wolfenbüttel 2012, 85-91, No. 13]

Dimension of sheet: 33.4 x 22.3 cm

[Cat. Wolfenbüttel 2012, 85-91, No. 13]
pageContext.markings:
on the reverse:
- Melanchthon's panegyric on the deceased prince and reformer (1553) 
[Cat. Wolfenbüttel 2012, 85-91, No. 13]

metadata.title: Portrait of Georg III, Prince of Anhalt

pageContext.provenance:
- unknown
- probably the portrait recorded in the university library, Helmstedt in 1750 
- 1913 transferred from there to the library in Wolfenbüttel
[Cat. Wolfenbüttel 2012, 85-91, No. 13]

restorationSurveys.overallAnalysis:
- the edge of the parchment is heavily stained, at the bottom there is a c. 0.7 cm tear 
- there are numerous small fixing holes along the edge 
- the surface exhibits horizontal wavy deformations 
- small folds in the area of the lower left coat of arms 
- abrasion at the bottom edge 
[Cat. Wolfenbüttel 2012, 85-91, No. 13]

restorationSurveys.remarks:
- small losses retouched with watercolours 
- framed (since removed) 
[Cat. Wolfenbüttel 2012, 85-91, No. 13]

pageContext.signature: Artist's insignia lower left background above the coat of arms: serpent with dropped wings and dated '1553'

titles.title: Portrait of Georg III, Prince of Anhalt
